course.subject: TEMG
course.name: Fintech for Engineers
course.description: Fintech has become the hot buzzword in Hong Kong with Accenture, Citibank, DBS, Nest, and now Standard Chartered and Baidu creating financial technology accelerator programs in the city. The goal of this course is to deepen student’s understanding of our current financial market and the potential application of future financial technologies through guest lectures, case studies and student teamwork.  We will review the financial system as it operates today and then discuss a variety of technologies such as mobile payments, block chain technology, and P2PL. The focus will be on “why” these technologies are emerging and what problems they may solve. During the class we will look at a variety of local fintech companies to provide real life examples. This is a highly interactive course, where student assessment is a combination of contribution to class discussion, case studies and presentations. For students of the Dual Degree Program in Technology and Management and other IPO students, and students with consent from the course instructor only.

reviews.author: Jainam
reviews.comment_content: Enjoyed the course overall. The material was well designed, and I learnt a lot of new things about the fintech space. Classes were interactive and we kept the dialogue going with some good discussions. I quite liked the guest speakers too.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tim was an excellent teacher. He made sure classes were fun and engaging. The material was clear and well explained with a lot of real world practical examples. He also often shared his insights into how the banking industry really works. Tim was always extremely friendly and easy to approach and he offered useful advice and feedback on our presentations.
reviews.comment_grading: Relatively relaxed grading. We had 17 students in the course, but grading was still curved. If you participate, shouldn't be hard to get A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Relatively low workload. 3 presentations, one each week.
